title: RuntimeError: only Tensors of floating point dtype can require gradients
body:
I am using
`shap==0.38.1`
`torch==1.7.1`

I have a MLP that takes a text input (preprocessed/encoded as LongTensor) and the model trains fine for the classification problem at hand. I use the LongTensor to look up embeddings in the forward function. However, when trying to use `shap.DeepExplainer.shap_values` I get below error

       100     def gradient(self, idx, inputs):
       101        self.model.zero_grad()
--> 102         X = [x.requires_grad_() for x in inputs]
       103         outputs = self.model(*X)
       104         selected = [val for val in outputs[:, idx]]

`RuntimeError: only Tensors of floating point dtype can require gradients`

I know that a similar issue has been raised [here](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/issues/1671), but wanted to register my case as I am using latest SHAP package and still get this error. I have simplified the NN to bring attention to the issue.

class NN(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, embeddings):
        super(NN, self).__init__()
        self.embeddings = embeddings
        self.dropout = nn.Dropout(p=0.1)
        ...
        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(in_dim, 5)
        self.fc2 = nn.Linear(100, 50)

    def forward(self, text):# If we have a second input (categorical) then we use it
        x = self.embeddings(text)
        ...
        out = self.fc2(features)
        return out
        
`e = shap.DeepExplainer(NN, preprocessed(text).long())`
`shap_values = e.shap_values(preprocessed(text).long())`

Kindly help.
